DOC.brief_summary: Background : Our previous study demonstrate electroacupuncture Zusanli , Sanyinjiao , Hegu , Zhigou reduce duration postoperative ileus hospital stay laparoscopic colorectal surgery within traditional perioperative care set . Recent evidence also suggest 'fast-track ' perioperative program may help accelerate recovery colorectal surgery . As electroacupuncture simpler implement less labor intensive , may prefer adjunct therapy proven noninferior fast-track program reduce duration postoperative ileus hospital stay laparoscopic colorectal surgery . Objectives : To compare efficacy electroacupuncture fast-track program reduce duration postoperative ileus hospital stay laparoscopic colorectal surgery . Design : Prospective , randomize , noninferiority trial . Subjects : One hundred sixty-four consecutive patient undergo elective laparoscopic resection colonic upper rectal cancer recruit . Interventions : Patients randomly allocate receive either : ( A ) electroacupuncture traditional perioperative care ; ( B ) fast-track program without acupuncture . Outcome measure : Primary outcome : time defecation . Secondary outcome : duration hospital stay , time first passing flatus , time resume diet , pain score , analgesic requirement , morbidity , medical cost . Conclusions : This study determine electroacupuncture noninferior fast-track program reduce duration postoperative ileus hospital stay laparoscopic colorectal surgery . Electroacupuncture may prefer perioperative adjunct therapy laparoscopic colorectal surgery simpler implement less labor intensive fast-track program .
DOC.brief_title: Electroacupuncture Versus Fast-track Perioperative Program Laparoscopic Colorectal Surgery
